summary: This is an FBI 302 interview summary of a witness (referred to as [REDACTED]) conducted on September 18, 2019, in Los Angeles. The witness describes being recruited as a minor in 2004 or 2005 to give Jeffrey Epstein a massage at his Palm Beach home, details the encounter, and mentions other individuals involved in the recruitment and transportation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; the witness describes visiting his Palm Beach home for a paid massage when she was underage, during which he engaged in inappropriate sexual contact.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: The primary interviewee, a stay-at-home mother. She describes being recruited as a minor (around 17) in 2004 or 2005 to give Epstein a massage for money at his Palm Beach home.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: A friend of the witness who had Epstein's contact number and recruited her and another girl ([REDACTED]) to give Epstein a massage. She drove them to Epstein's home and was paid more for bringing other girls.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: Another girl recruited alongside the witness to visit Epstein's home. The witness states she was 'more wild' and may have visited Epstein more than once.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: A woman present at Epstein's home who greeted the witness and her friend, told them Epstein would be ready soon, and instructed them to get into their bras and underwear.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: An individual who arrived with [REDACTED] (known to law enforcement as [REDACTED]) to pick up the witness and her friend after their visit to Epstein's home. They all then went to a Florida Marlins game.

persons.name: Bob Josefsberg
persons.context: Identified as the attorney for [REDACTED], who sued Epstein. The witness received some money for speaking on behalf of that lawsuit.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: An individual known to law enforcement who was in the car with [REDACTED] when picking up the witness from Epstein's home.

events.title: Witness's Visit to Epstein's Home
events.description: The witness ([REDACTED]), then a minor in high school, was driven by [REDACTED] to Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach home. She and [REDACTED] gave Epstein a massage in a pool house massage room. Epstein engaged in inappropriate sexual contact with the witness.

events.title: Payment and Recruitment Discussion
events.description: After the massage, the witness was paid $300 in Epstein's kitchen. [REDACTED] told her you get paid more for bringing other girls.

events.title: [REDACTED]'s Lawsuit Against Epstein
events.description: [REDACTED] sued Jeffrey Epstein. The witness ([REDACTED]) received some money for speaking on behalf of that lawsuit, which was handled by attorney Bob Josefsberg.

events.title: FBI Interview of Witness
events.description: The witness ([REDACTED]) was interviewed by the FBI, an AUSA, and a detective in Los Angeles, California, regarding her experiences with Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Epstein's home in Palm Beach (with pool house massage room)
keyFacts: A witness ([REDACTED]) describes being recruited as a minor (17 years old, either 2004 or 2005) to give Jeffrey Epstein a massage at his Palm Beach home for $200.
During the massage, Epstein grabbed the witness's buttocks, pulled her closer, and made inappropriate requests, including asking her to touch his nipples.
The recruitment was facilitated by a friend ([REDACTED]) who had Epstein's contact, drove the girls, and was told you get paid more for bringing other girls.
Another girl present ([REDACTED]) later sued Epstein, and the witness received some money for speaking on behalf of that lawsuit, which was handled by attorney Bob Josefsberg.
The document is an FBI 302 interview summary, indicating ongoing federal investigation into Epstein's activities as of late 2019.
